summary: The bill, titled the "Unleashing Needed Local Options to Construct and Keep Housing Act" or "UNLOCK Act," aims to amend the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. It focuses on expanding new home construction, specifically targeting low- and moderate-income housing. The legislation proposes modifications to existing sections of the act, including amending language related to financial assistance for housing projects, ultimately supporting the construction of new residential housing in various jurisdictions.
